member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilterService
member.summary: Provides the standard implementation for attaching a to a control.
member.remarks:
This class allows you to attach filters to grids using XAML. For example:
<c1:C1FlexGrid x:Name="_flex" > <ff:C1FlexGridFilterService.FlexGridFilter> <ff:C1FlexGridFilter /> </ff:C1FlexGridFilterService.FlexGridFilter> </c1:C1FlexGrid>

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilterService.GetFlexGridFilter(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the value of the FlexGridFilter attached property of the specified object.
member.param: Object to query concerning the FlexGridFilter property.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilterService.SetFlexGridFilter(System.Windows.DependencyObject,C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter)
member.summary: Sets the value of the FlexGridFilter property of the specified object.
member.param: Object to set the property on.

member.summary: Handles changes to the FlexGridFilter attached property.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.Editor
member.summary: Gets the used to edit the filter parameters.

remarks.para: This property is useful if you want to customize the appearance of the built-in filter editor.

By default, the filter editor uses the style properties set on the grid (e.g. Background, FontFamily, FontSize, etc). In some cases, you may want to override this behavior and specify the editor's properties directly.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.FilterApplied
member.summary: Occurs when the filter is applied to the grid.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.EditorOpened
member.summary: Occurs when the filter editor is displayed.
member.remarks: You can get a reference to the filter editor using the property.

member.name: E:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.EditorClosed
member.summary: Occurs when the filter editor is closed.
member.remarks: You can get a reference to the filter editor using the property.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.UseCollectionView
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the filter should be applied to the grid's data source.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, the filter is applied to the being used as the grid data source. Filters applied this way reflect on all objects bound to the same

If this property is set to false, the filter is applied directly to the grid rows. Data that is filtered out remains in the grid and in the data source, but is hidden from the UI since the rows become invisible.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridFilter.FilterDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets the current filter definition as an XML string.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.FilterExtensionMethods
member.summary: Provides extension methods to support grid and column filtering.

remarks.para: The extension methods are optional. They are useful for simplifying the syntax and making applications easier to read.
For example, the code below uses the standard syntax to enable filtering on a grid and to customize the first two column filters:
Using the extension methods, you could re-write this code as follows:

member.summary: Extension method to enable or disable column filtering on a .

Whether to enable or disable filtering on the grid.

member.summary: No filtering.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator
member.summary: Represents operators that can be used in filter conditions.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.None
member.summary: Disables the operator.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.Equals
member.summary: Return true if the value equals the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.DoesNotEqual
member.summary: Return true if the value does not equal the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.IsGreaterThan
member.summary: Return true if the value is greater than the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.IsLessThan
member.summary: Return true if the value is less than the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.IsGreaterThanOrEqualTo
member.summary: Return true if the value is greater than or equal to the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.IsLessThanOrEqualTo
member.summary: Return true if the value is less than or equal to the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.Contains
member.summary: Return true if the string representation of the value contains the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.DoesNotContain
member.summary: Return true if the string representation of the value does not contain the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.BeginsWith
member.summary: Return true if the string representation of the value begins with the operator parameter.

member.name: F:C1.Silverlight.FlexGrid.ConditionOperator.EndsWith
member.summary: Return true if the string representation of the value ends with the operator parameter.
